records.context_note: A Frontex Surveillance Aircraft observed an empty rubber boat being towed by a Hellenic Coast Guard vessel towards Turkish Territorial waters. Approximately 20-30 people were on board the Hellenic Coast Guard vessel and were retransferred onto the rubber boat at the Greek-Turkish border. The Hellenic Coast Guard stated the Turkish Coast Guard took over responsibility, but this could not be corroborated.
records.evidence_quote: In the night of 18 April 2020, a Frontex Surveillance Aircraft observed a rubber boat in Greek Territorial waters. The rubber boat was empty and being towed by a Hellenic Coast Guard vessel towards Turkish Territorial waters. Approximately 20-30 people were on board the Hellenic Coast Guard vessel that was towing the rubber boat. After some time, these people were retransferred onto the rubber boat at the Greek-Turkish border.

The boat was later observed moving towards Turkish Territorial waters. The Hellenic Coast Guard stated the boat was seaworthy and people were non-cooperative, preventing requests for international protection.

possible_violations.violation_name: Alleged threatening behaviour by Hellenic Coast Guard officers

records.context_note: Migrants reported to Frontex Team Members on Kos Island that a Hellenic Coast Guard Patrol Boat created large waves and made gestures implying return to Turkey upon their arrival in Greek territorial waters. The Hellenic Coast Guard presented a different chronology of events. Allegations of threatening behavior could not be substantiated from video footage for the depicted timeframe.
records.evidence_quote: During a screening procedure on Kos Island, migrants reported to Frontex Team Members that on 9 November 2020, upon their arrival with a rubber boat in Greek territorial waters, a Hellenic Coast Guard Patrol Boat arrived on scene, created large waves and made the rubber boat rock from side to side. One Border Guard Officer from the Hellenic Coast Guard made gestures with a large pointy object to imply their return back to Turkey.

The sole Frontex-reported incident (No 406283) for that period was near Lesvos and did not raise specific concerns. possible_violations.legal_basis: Article 80(2) of Regulation (EU) 2019/1896, principle of non-refoulement

records.context_note: An incident involving a boat with approx. 20 persons was reported by the Agency on 29 April 2020. The Working Group examined if this was linked to a Bellingcat report of a 'maritime pushback' near Samos. It was concluded that Frontex was not notified of or linked to the Bellingcat incident. The only Frontex-reported incident (No 406283) for that period was near Lesvos and did not raise specific concerns.
records.evidence_quote: According to the information provided by the Agency, an incident, which involved a boat with approx. 20 persons on board, was reported on 29 April 2020 by the Agency.
